name: Christophe Sauvat Lace Tunic
description:
Based in Lisbon Portugal, Christophe Sauvat’s range offers apparel and accessories made with ancient traditional forms of printing, embroidery, weaving and dyeing. As the co founder of Antik Batik, Christophe’s well known and loved ethnic, gypset style is an elegant fusion of cultures, lifestyle and design. 

Christophe Sauvat’s Lace Tunic is semi-sheer, lightweight and beautifully crafted from white cotton, with exquisite lace details.

• Christophe Sauvat
• Made in India
• 100% cotton, lace detail
• Colour: White
• Hand wash

name: Nanushka Vega Shorts
description:
Sandra Sandor, also known as Nanushka, established her uber chic label in her home town of Budapest after studying at the London College of Fashion. Pieces are beautifully cut and crafted from lush fabrics, harmoniously merging elegance and comfort. Collections are influenced by her Hungarian roots, giving them a mysterious boho vibe, yet keeping every piece effortless, minimal and earthy.

Nanushka’s Vega Shorts are beautifully screen printed with illustrations of the magical Hungarian folk tale, Világszép Nádszál Kisasszony, written by Benedek Elek. It tells the story of a young prince who sets out to find and wed the most beautiful damsel in the world. Ignoring discouraging words, he crosses the Black Sea, battles dragons and passes through the dome of the sun, to finally save her from her cocoon prison, a stem of reed.

• Nanushka
• Made in Hungary
• 100% cotton
• Colour: Story Print
• Hand wash

name: Péro Skirt
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianness of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. It’s not about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones attire.

Designer and founder, Aneeth Arora, is a textile and fashion graduate. What fascinates and inspires her most is the way locals are so unintentionally chic. She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

Cut from super soft, lightweight, hand spun cotton, this skirt is the ultimate fusion of Indian materials and techniques and classic European style. Pleating, hand stitched buttons and a no fuss waistband give this piece an ultra-feminine finish.

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton
• Code & Colour: CH WPB PS03: Blue / CH WPB PS05: White
• Dry clean only
• Can be small to size

name: Rabens Saloner Scoop Necked Blouse
description:
Rabens Saloner, established by designer Birgitte Raben Olrik, is a fusion of relaxed (yet fashion conscious) style and a genuine love for traditional Asian craftsmanship. Birgitte travels to all corners of Asia, where she collaborates with dressmakers, leather smiths, bonepolishers, armies of knitting grandmas, and Nepalese men huddled in groups of four, to stitch the most breathtaking pieces for her collections.

Lightweight, loose and airy, this blouse perfectly represents the brand’s effortless, comfortable approach. A simple, timeless piece and a suitcase essential!

• Rabens Saloner
• Made in Thailand
• 100% cotton 
• Colour: Soya
• Hand wash

name: Rabens Saloner Tucked Neckline Dress
description:
Rabens Saloner, established by designer Birgitte Raben Olrik, is a fusion of relaxed (yet fashion conscious) style and a genuine love for traditional Asian craftsmanship. Birgitte travels to all corners of Asia, where she collaborates with dressmakers, leather smiths, bonepolishers, armies of knitting grandmas, and Nepalese men huddled in groups of four, to stitch the most breathtaking pieces for her collections.

New in store, the Autumn-Winter collection remains true to the designer’s relaxed style, with loose fitting pieces cut from simple cottons in earthy shades, and subtle yet elegantly stitched details.

• Rabens Saloner
• Made in Thailand
• 100% cotton
• Colours: White / Mulberry / Moon Mist
• Hand wash

name: Khadi & Co. Globo Skirt
description:
Spun by a million hands, and a movement toward economic independence, rural self-employment and self-reliance propelled by Gandhi, ‘khadi’ is the name of a hand woven cotton cloth. This was the inspiration behind Khadi & Co., founded by Danish textile designer Bess Nielsen. Based in Paris, Khadi & Co. create a range of products that blend the expertise behind Indian textiles with classic European design. Simple, elegant, durable and timeless, Khadi & Co is the life-blood of whole villages in Kerala, Penjab and Bengal.

Khadi & Co.’s indigo pieces for their SS13 collection define cross season, minimal dressing. The Globo Skirt, spun from a mix of cotton and silk, with a cut that falls ever so elegantly and flatteringly over all hips, is a statement piece for all occasions.

• Khadi & Co.
• Made in India
• 70% cotton 30% silk
• Colour: Indigo
• Dry clean only

name: Péro Men's Reversible Shirt
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianness of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. It’s not about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones attire.

Designer and founder, Aneeth Arora, is a textile and fashion graduate. What fascinates and inspires her most is the way locals are so unintentionally chic. She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

Péro’s reversible shirts achieve a refined-yet-casual look, combining excellent craftsmanship with quality materials and details. A ‘shirt within a shirt’, fabric is double layered and has the flexibility to be worn as a classic white shirt with a twist or as a fine check. Buttons are hand crafted chrome, with one single button at the back of the collar. This shirt is truly an investment piece for every wardrobe and is surely a rare find!

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton
• Code & Colour: CH MPS DS03: White + Plaid
• Dry clean only
• Reversible

Christophe Sauvat’s Western Vest is an absolute masterpiece! Completely hand beaded (front and back), and lined with cotton, it’s a lust-have for all seasons.

name: Nanushka Gea Folk Shirt Dress
description:
Sandra Sandor, also known as Nanushka, established her uber chic label in her home town of Budapest after studying at the London College of Fashion. Pieces are beautifully cut and crafted from lush fabrics, harmoniously merging elegance and comfort. Collections are influenced by her Hungarian roots, giving them a mysterious boho vibe, yet keeping every piece effortless, minimal and earthy.

Nanushka’s Gea Folk Shirt Dress remains true to the collection’s mood; an earthy palette with beautifully tailored details, and touches of ethnic chic that give this piece edgy elegance.

• Nanushka
• Made in Hungary
• 100% cotton 
• Colour: Tan/Creme
• Alternative colour available: Creme (contact shop@soroco.gr for images)
• Hand wash

name: Péro Kids Reversible Dress
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianness of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. It’s not about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones attire.

Designer and founder, Aneeth Arora, is a textile and fashion graduate. What fascinates and inspires her most is the way locals are so unintentionally chic. She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

Péro’s children’t line is the most magnificent I’ve seen, and their reversible girls dresses can only be described as ‘couture for children’. All hand tailored and cleverly cut to fit your child for two years, this ‘dress within a dress’ is double layered, with the flexibility to be worn either as beautiful blue cheque with touches of white embroidered details and ikat trim, or as a fine blue, burgundy and white plaid. With such love, care and attention to detail poured into these exquisitely unique pieces, who can resist?! Every little girl’s wardrobe deserves at least one!

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton
• Code & Colour: CH KD15 : Blue + Plaid
• Dry clean only
• Reversible

name: Péro Bag
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianness of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. It’s not about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones attire.

Designer and founder, Aneeth Arora, is a textile and fashion graduate. What fascinates and inspires her most is the way locals are so unintentionally chic. She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

This is definitely an ideal shape and size to fit everything in! Haul your every day essentials, or use as a travel or beach accessory as it packs flat and opens to a large tote. Spacious, roomy and intricately stitched from hand-embroidered cotton and silk textiles, with hand finished buttons and button holes on the two inner pockets. Leather straps are also attached with hand finished buttons on the outside... what’s not to love about this bag?!

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton 
• Code: PJ G02
• Size: 74cm wide x 32.5cm deep x 42cm high
• Dry clean only
• Front and back side in different fabric

name: Clare Vivier Oversize Clutch
description:
Like most good things, Clare Vivier began making bags in response to a need. She fuses classic French glamour with minimalist Los Angeles cool to produce a line of carryables that are as chic as they are utilitarian. Clare Vivier’s design principle is timeless but her aesthetic is bold, always taking into consideration the elegant tension between modern detail and classic shapes. Clare Vivier’s line has been made exclusively in Los Angeles since 2008, consciously engaging in ethical manufacturing practice without compromise.

The original CV bag, the Oversize Clutch is the epitome of multi-functionality and style. Padded with durable cotton lining this clutch will keep your laptop safe without bulkiness. This clutch also easily transitions as a day or evening bag with ample room for all your personal items.

• Clare Vivier
• Made in California
• Leather, Chrome, Cotton
• Colour: Black Pebble
• Size: 43cm x 30.5cm
• Lined

name: Clare Vivier Adam's Duffle
description:
Like most good things, Clare Vivier began making bags in response to a need. She fuses classic French glamour with minimalist Los Angeles cool to produce a line of carryables that are as chic as they are utilitarian. Clare Vivier’s design principle is timeless but her aesthetic is bold, always taking into consideration the elegant tension between modern detail and classic shapes. Clare Vivier’s line has been made exclusively in Los Angeles since 2008, consciously engaging in ethical manufacturing practice without compromise.

The first in Clare Vivier’s men’s line; Adam’s Duffle embodies handsome contradiction with a durable canvas body and reinforced leather bottom. Versatile and roomy, this duffle features a leather wrapped hemp handle, detachable hemp shoulder strap, and chrome hardware.

• Clare Vivier
• Made in California
• Canvas, Leather, Chrome 
• Colour: Natural/Camel
• Dimensions: 45.7cm x 25.4cm x 28cm / 10cm handle drop / 33cm shoulder drop
• Lined

name: Dutzi Design Burlap Clutch
description:
Ariane Dutzi, designer and founder of Dutzi Design, was formerly a fashion editor in Paris and New York before moving to Yucatan to start her line of bags. The workshop, established in 2009, was created to help Mayan men and women generate income and therefore strengthen their local community. Each person involved is trained on how to hand craft Ariane’s designs, provided with all materials required to do so, and then paid individually for their work. We have loved and supported Ariane and her cause from the day Soroco opened it’s doors in 2010... she is an absolute inspiration!

Ariane’s vintage burlap clutches have been Soroco’s staple accessory every summer. An easy, light clutch, with cotton lining, inner pocket, leather trim and zip closure, it’s a favorite when you want to down-size and keep it simple!

• Made in Mexico
• Vintage burlap, leather, cotton lining
• Size: (L) 36cm wide x 27.5cm high
• Size: (M) 30cm wide x 24cm high
• Size: (S) 25.5cm wide x 16cm high
• Size: (XS) 16cm wide x 11cm high

name: Dutzi Design Burlap Fringe Messenger
description:
Ariane Dutzi, designer and founder of Dutzi Design, was formerly a fashion editor in Paris and New York before moving to Yucatan to start her line of bags. The workshop, established in 2009, was created to help Mayan men and women generate income and therefore strengthen their local community. Each person involved is trained on how to hand craft Ariane’s designs, provided with all materials required to do so, and then paid individually for their work. We have loved and supported Ariane and her cause from the day Soroco opened it’s doors in 2010... she is an absolute inspiration!

Beautifully hand crafted from vintage burlap, this messenger is a timeless accessory to add to your vacation wardrobe. Light weight, flat pack and easy to carry, with suede fringe detail, zip closure and fully lined. Effortlessly cool!

• Made in Mexico
• Vintage burlap, suede, cotton lining
• Dimensions: 19cm wide x 30cm high / 60cm shoulder drop

name: K Jacques Flavia Sandals: Natural
description:
K Jacques footwear was established in the 1930s in a small workshop in Saint Tropez, with every shoe made to measure. It quickly became synonymous with French Riviera style. Still family-owned, this luxury shoe brand remains the go-to for chic leather flats.

The Flavia Sandal remains a timeless classic in every collection - a leather flat that becomes even more gorgeous with wear.

• K Jacques St Tropez
• Made in St Tropez
• 100% leather 
• Colour: Natural
• Italian sizing, can be small to size

name: Péro Scarf
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianness of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. It’s not about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones attire.

She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

An effortlessly stylish accessory for all seasons, Péro’s scarves are lightweight, cool and versatile. Wear them to the beach, as a wrap on a summer’s evening or as a scarf in cooler months. Their patterns and hand crafted details are exquisitely unique - Indian chic for the jet set.

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton
• Code & Colour: CH PL J10B: White/Blue
• Size: 118cm x 400cm
• Dry clean only

description:
Spun by a million hands, and a movement toward economic independence, rural self-employment and self-reliance propelled by Gandhi, ‘khadi’ is the name of a hand woven cotton cloth. This was the inspiration behind Khadi & Co., founded by Danish textile designer Bess Nielsen. Based in Paris, Khadi & Co. create a range of products that blend the expertise behind Indian textiles with classic European design. Simple, elegant, durable and timeless, Khadi & Co is the life-blood of whole villages in Kerala, Penjab and Bengal.

name: Tunisian Fouta 'Hammamet'
description:
Foutas are the traditional towels of Tunisia. Woven and crafted in the Arabic medina of Hammamet, they are ideal as an alternative to a regular beach towel; also doubling as a beach wrap. Light, quick dry and outstanding quality, their versatility makes them one of Soroco’s beach essentials every summer. Can also be used as a bath towel or throw over your couch or arm chair.

• Made in Tunisia
• 100% cotton 
• Size: 100cm x 200cm
• Colours: Terracotta / Ochre / Beige / Grey
• Cold machine wash

name: Péro Towel 056A
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianess of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the Indian tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the natural materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro is, without doubt, a journey that must be experienced.

In Spring Summer 2013, Péro introduced its home line, a collection of the most beautiful towels I’ve ever laid my eyes on! The detail and quality of each one is unsurpassed, with tiny tassels, mother of pearl or silver buttons and pom poms, hand woven details and stitching, they are an investment for any home. Use as a bath towel, as a throw over your couch or arm chair or as a beach towel or wrap.

• Péro
• Made in India
• 81% cotton 19% linen 
• Code: PH TOW 056A
• Size: 87cm x 194cm
• Dry clean only

name: Péro Towel 035B
description:
‘Péro’ means ‘to wear’ in Marwari, the local language of Rajasthan. The Indianess of Péro rests in the process in which pieces are made; materials pass through the hands of one craftsperson to the other, all located in different areas of India, carrying forward the age old tradition of hand weaving and crafting, to create pieces that are as unique as they are exquisite.

Designer and founder, Aneeth Arora, is a textile and fashion graduate. She puts machinery aside, picks up a needle and thread, and hand crafts all of her pieces, together with her network of craftspeople. The love and soul that is poured into each and every piece in her collection radiates... and when the materials first touch your skin, there simply is no turning back. Péro isn't about an age group or season; it’s a mindset, a way of life, and willingness to incorporate the effortless style of the local people into ones every day attire.

In Spring Summer 2013, Péro introduced its home line, a collection of the most beautiful towels imaginable! The detail and quality of each one is unsurpassed; tiny tassels, mother of pearl or silver buttons and pom poms, hand woven details and stitching, they are an investment for any home. Use as a bath towel, as a throw over your couch or arm chair or as a beach towel or wrap.

• Péro
• Made in India
• 100% cotton 
• Code: PH TOW 035B
• Size: 106cm x 182cm
• Dry clean only

name: Leif Body Balm
description:
A land whose natives have developed in isolation over millions of years was bound to create some diverse individuals, and it has. From the rainforest to the outback the Australian climate tends to weed out all but the most vital plants, which helps create products that move both body and mind. Leif formulations combine botanical extracts with pure essential oils that offer their own task specific natural selection. Darwin would surely approve - and so do we! 

Apply Leif Body Balm  generously to damp skin after showering.

Wild Rosella & Alpine Pepper ‘Hydration’ Body Balm
A wonderfully aromatic lotion that leaves your skin scented and highly hydrated.

Desert Lime, Vanilla & Orange ‘Deep Calm’ Body Balm
Essential oils of citrus combine with vanilla to warm and calm.

Lemon Myrtle, Sandalwood & Eucalyptus ‘Invigoration’ Body Balm
A trifecta of Australian natives combined to help bring vitality to your day.

• Made in Australia
• All natural Australian products
• 260ml

name: Leif Body Cleanser
description:
A land whose natives have developed in isolation over millions of years was bound to create some diverse individuals, and it has. From the rainforest to the outback the Australian climate tends to weed out all but the most vital plants, which helps create products that move both body and mind. Leif formulations combine botanical extracts with pure essential oils that offer their own task specific natural selection. Darwin would surely approve - and so do we! 

Use Leif Body Cleanser as a shower gel or in the bath, massaging a generous amount onto damp skin before rinsing thoroughly to cleanse and deodorise. Follow up with a Leif Body Balm to moisturise and protect.

Desert Lime, Vanilla & Orange ‘Deep Calm’ Body Cleanser
Essential oils of citrus combine with vanilla to warm and calm.

Wild Rosella & Alpine Pepper ‘Hydration’ Body Cleanser
A wonderfully aromatic gel that leaves your skin scented and highly hydrated.

Lemon Myrtle, Sandalwood & Eucalyptus ‘Invigoration’ Body Cleanser
A trifecta of Australian natives combined to help bring vitality to your day.

• Made in Australia
• All natural Australian products
• 260ml

name: Exfoliating Mitt
description:
An authentic Turkish hamam exfoliating mitt, or ‘kese’ as it is known in Turkish, is used to remove dead skin from the body. They're made on old-style looms or hand-woven. All have been laboratory tested in Turkey and certified organic. 

Using kese is considered one of the best things you can do for the health of your skin. Removal of dead skin using kese promotes the growth of new healthy cells, impedes the build-up of cellulite and increases the circulation and health of the skin.

• Jennifer’s Hamam
• Made in Turkey
• Colour: Grey

name: Sandalwood Beads
description:
Made with love by hand, this sandalwood beaded necklace remains, season after season, Soroco’s essential summer accessory. The antique icon of Saint Anna from Buenos Aires hangs restfully on 150 sandalwood beads and antique African separating beads. Priceless, unique, timeless and absolutely exquisite teamed with crisp cottons in the summer.

• Made in Symi
• Natural sandalwood beads, antique African beads, chrome antique icon, waxed cotton
• Icon: Saint Anna
• Length: 49.5cm
